column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Edit 2/19/16: Response to reply below:  So not to be deterred by my experience at Jinya and ready for a comparison
column2: I went and tried Tiger Den last night.  You may visit their page for my review
column3: but I'm glad I did.  In my own opinion
column4: my experience there was much better
column5: it was like I entered flavor town and lost myself for a while in a slurping taste bud fest
column6: my eggs were like nothing I ever had before and cooked to this delicate silky perfection
column7: while on the otherhand at Jinya my eggs seemed old and overcooked)
column8: At Tiger Den the prices were at a considerably cheaper starting point and I feel the bowls there were larger.   In my Opinion
column9: Jinya I left me with that feeling that what I ate I could have made at home much better with a store brand ramen pouch. Tiger Den
column10: the flavor profiles were complex and that I could never make exactly the same thing from scratch)
